transcripts.text: When I'm performing on stage, I feel like a role model because there's a lot of people who are watching.  This is amazing, like, teaching your culture to others.  It feels so good.  Not a lot of people have that kind of, you know, that kind of chance to do that.  My name is Nima Abdi, and I am 18 years old, and we moved here in the United States in 2012.  I heard about the dance troupe.  There was a day that they were doing a dance at the street.  It was open street.  Right away, I fall in love.  And I love like the dance that they were doing.  And I just feel like, I just feel like I just seeing me doing that dance, you know?

The students from the Somali Museum Dance Troupe are made out of high school and college students.  We meet every Saturday from 4 to 6 and we practice together.  We have traveled all over the US entertaining audience and at the same time educating them about our Somali culture.
